subs.text: February 26

@horsemankukka @Foone Fair; my BASIC knowledge is 30+ years out of date.

Without seeing the rest of the code, I considered that the success code may have just been from the local serial driver, and the inquired frame number displayed on the TV/video output via the text generator board (vs serial rx).
subs.rawText:
@horsemankukka @Foone Fair; my BASIC knowledge is 30+ years out of date.

Without seeing the rest of the code, I considered that the success code may have just been from the local serial driver, and the inquired frame number displayed on the TV/video output via the text generator board (vs serial rx).

subs.text:
@Foone I‚Äôm assuming you‚Äôve tried sending every possible character, in sequence, from ox00 to 0xff‚Ä¶

Last thought‚Ä¶ USB RS-232C interfaces didn‚Äôt exist back then‚Ä¶ perhaps the player is sinking more current than your (presumed) RS-232E USB adapter is designed or configured to supply?
subs.rawText:
@Foone I‚Äôm assuming you‚Äôve tried sending every possible character, in sequence, from ox00 to 0xff‚Ä¶

Last thought‚Ä¶ USB RS-232C interfaces didn‚Äôt exist back then‚Ä¶ perhaps the player is sinking more current than your (presumed) RS-232E USB adapter is designed or configured to supply?

subs.text:
@Foone What voltage is your RS-232 driver putting out?

Perhaps the player is more picky than the spec (especially considering capacitor aging)‚Ä¶ but based on the light (and other reactions) you mentioned, it does seem the player is sensing a connection in some way.
subs.rawText:
@Foone What voltage is your RS-232 driver putting out?

Perhaps the player is more picky than the spec (especially considering capacitor aging)‚Ä¶ but based on the light (and other reactions) you mentioned, it does seem the player is sensing a connection in some way.

subs.text: @Foone I don‚Äôt remember seeing a serial _out_ pin on the main control processor for the `MR1`, so I wouldn‚Äôt get too discouraged by not seeing any serial data _from_ the Sony: [link]

subs.text:
@Foone Octal was used a bunch back then; a long shot, but those single character commands in the BASIC source might be specified in decimal, hex, or octal??

i.e.:
Clear LDP: 8 or V or .
Index disp on: 2 or P or (
Search: + or C or #
Repeat: , or D or $
Frame inq: < or ` or 0
subs.rawText:

subs.text:
@Foone Also, it could be a one-way protocol‚Ä¶ just like an infrared remote control.

Most shuttle-jog and similar controllers from the era had no display at all; they would not expect nor listen to any feedback from the device (except for perhaps invisible RS-232 flow-control codes).
subs.rawText:
@Foone Also, it could be a one-way protocol‚Ä¶ just like an infrared remote control.

Most shuttle-jog and similar controllers from the era had no display at all; they would not expect nor listen to any feedback from the device (except for perhaps invisible RS-232 flow-control codes).

subs.text: @Foone Several FutureVideo controllers supported that model via their FV0079 cable - perhaps that will lead somewhere promising. (Bonus: a small company like that wil l have a _much_ smaller patent search space than either JVC or Sony!) [link] https://t.co/iGTvBAj9Nb

subs.text:
@ftp_alun @concreted0g @Hogan698 @bookwormwmb @TheRealHoarse @shaunwalker7 You could reload paintballs with actual paint (or other substances), right?

A syringe with an ISO 18 G (or larger) needle should probably work, available from any pharmacy. Farm and veterinary suppliers also have them.

subs.text: February 18

@ternoveau @436bGliese @wideofthepost @haymarketbooks Exactly.

Javert was indeed a tragic hero.

The system failed _everyone_. Miserably.

(At least we have space weapons and Netflix now, so progress?)

@sp_redelectric @offlineleft @PresidentJose3 @AmtrakConnects Fair. At least those in Europe have options (and @db_bahn has a great website).

In most places in the USA lucky enough to be connected by @Amtrak interstate trains, there is often only one train per day, making connections _very_ difficult (even _if_ the first train is on time).

@sp_redelectric @offlineleft @PresidentJose3 @AmtrakConnects @DB_Bahn @Amtrak Also, some folks appear lucky, e.g.:
 - Paris - Venice with only one connection (#TGV-#EC).
 - London - Amsterdam with zero (@Eurostar).

Bucure»ôti to M√°laga has a ton of connections, I'll give you that!

@sp_redelectric @offlineleft @PresidentJose3 @AmtrakConnects One sometimes has to change trains three times between one side of NYC and another side of NYC.

If train schedules are reasonably aligned and with frequent service, connections can be a nice change to stretch ones legs / make phone calls / etc.
@BMunise @offlineleft That makes us look even worse!

@SherlockHemloc2 @wideofthepost Drug crimes are signs of systemic societal dysfunction.

Until we confront that, any ‚Äòwar on drugs‚Äô has less chance of sustained success than a land war in Asia.
@propcharles @jcschmieder @wideofthepost Or leave your doors unlocked with a $20 on the seat.

@jcschmieder @wideofthepost The same ‚Äòinnocent‚Äô residents that routinely drive by their unhoused cousins and do little or nothing to help?

(help can be provided in many non-financial ways - being active in local politics, befriending folks on the street, etc‚Ä¶)

@436bGliese @wideofthepost @haymarketbooks It‚Äôs a terrible tragic tale.

Javert worked so hard, from nothing, and all he ever wanted was respect for doing the right thing.

@pattyheffley @Sallamoon1 @joeyfox85 A damp towel placed over an inexpensive box fan not only cools (slightly) the air but humidifies it as well.

A pan of water left on top of a radiator or inside a sunny winter window helps with humidity, too.

@BlueDebonair @jessejanderson That way, I can always scroll back through my photo library, zoom in on the relevant photos, and search for something of which I have a spatial recollection.

I don‚Äôt sort the photos or put them in albums. I rarely look back at them, but it‚Äôs sure nice to have the option!

@BlueDebonair @jessejanderson Finally, for really big or important jobs, I‚Äôll actually also use a dedicated audio recorder (digital or microcassette, as long as it has voice-activated ‚ÄòVOX‚Äô) mode. I say the date / place at the very start, then narrate what I‚Äôm doing (e.g.‚Äúputting holiday wreath into red box‚Äù)

@Kelsie_McVeety @the_tweedy A non-preferred name shouldn‚Äôt appear _anywhere_ on paperwork or computer screens past reception.

(If it has to appear for some legal/regulatory reason, in should be in a very tiny font away from other names.)

@brydone_jack @AlissaEvenson @TSevert @Fad1878 Perhaps they‚Äôre used to rural providers not having good equipment to read disks‚Ä¶ also, a cracked film is readable; a cracked CD might not be.

(also, the film is likely to still be readable in 20 years‚Ä¶ but will a computer with CD drive be common in 2040?)
February 15

@BlueDebonair @jessejanderson What I have heard most often is that any useful storage tend to be 

 - open / transparent

    ‚Ä¶ or ‚Ä¶

 - closed and cataloged

@BlueDebonair @jessejanderson Personally, I use numbered ‚ÄòBanker‚Äôs Boxes‚Äô stacked floor to ceiling inside of a large closet, and a clipboard (with pre-lined paper) that lives on a wall hook just outside the closet door. 

One could instead use any nice-looking box/drawer/bin/jar.

@BlueDebonair @jessejanderson A. Want to store something? 

 1. Write name of thing on clipboard,
 2. open door, 
 3. find _any_ box with free space and insert item
 4. write box number on clipboard.

@BlueDebonair @jessejanderson B. Want to find something?

 1. Flip through pages on clipboard to find where you wrote down the thing.
 2. Cross-off item from list and 
 3. grab item from that numbered box.
@TeeDee32390904 @LadiRadi Apparently there exist machinations that cause many defendants to ‚Äòwaive‚Äô that right‚Ä¶

@Gotgoodies_ @amarelovex @izumabakumatsu @Peckham_Heights @OneMileataTime Agricultural field workers _finally_ have normal minimum wage (and overtime) eligibility in Washington State, and the sub-minimum wage for tipped restaurant workers has been gone in many western states for some time now.

Progress, yes, but slow and regional.
February 13

@amarelovex @Gotgoodies_ @izumabakumatsu @Peckham_Heights @OneMileataTime When the minimum wage laws were originally passed, several major categories of jobs (that were mostly held by women and minorities with no political power) were excluded, e.g.: 
 - restaurant servers,
 - agricultural field workers, and
 - disabled workers in special ‚Äòworkshops‚Äô.

@twinni_two @cmmhartmann On a zoom call of only sighted folks, I could imagine this being useful to associate voices with tiny thumbnail videos, so that when ‚ÄòJena with the black cat on her desk‚Äô speaks, you can look at her appropriate square?

Perhaps more important with the shift to hybrid meetings?

@pinkrocktopus @SaraAnnedipity @LouisatheLast @cmmhartmann Maybe if there were three ‚ÄòJaras‚Äô in the room and the so you could mentally associate one as ‚ÄúGreenshirt Jara‚Äù and another as ‚ÄúRedshirt Jara‚Äù?

@alicetragedy @cmmhartmann In a well-crafted presentation, aren‚Äôt most images actually ‚Äòvisual aids‚Äô, designed to help compensate for the average sighted person having poor listening / reading comprehension skills?

@jeverehowell @DrDanSchumacher @DrRissman Those with certain government security clearances are REQUIRED to undergo the procedure WITHOUT any type of sedation. 

Knowing this, an experienced provider can often manage any discomfort with ease, adding no more than a few minutes to the entire procedure.

@GMooBah @BadRaving @KS4P45 @floellaella Even the ‚Äòexpensive‚Äô options tend to have only a 7-10 year payback period.

If you own a home and plan on living there for a decade+, it‚Äôs worth taking the time to add up your current gas/oil/electric usage and compare costs over a longer term. Especially with low interest rates.
